Reviews.Title: “DO NOT SELECT THIS HOTEL! There are 534 alternatives in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: MalibuHarley
Reviews.Content: This is the first negative post I have ever made, You read reviews and book a hotel for location, to avoid bedbugs, for service, etc. I have had a terrible experience with this hotel booking it through Agoda.com. I would avoid Agoda at all costs. I placed my reservation via the internet, The agoda site was sloppy and I inadvertently booked 2 rooms instead of one room. I also thought the rate per night was the rate for the 2 night stay. So, I booked a charge that was 4X what my expected cost would be. NO WHERE ON THE BOOKING CONFIRMATION DO I VISIBLY SEE THE TERM "Non-Cancelllable". When my confirm was sent with 4X the charges expected, I immediately requested the reservation to be cancelled. Agoda confirmed the cancellation, but according to Pat in Agoda customer service, the hotel will not refund my money. I have a copy of the booking and nowhere does it say non-cancellable in the booking summary. Bottom line--It is not just about location, restaurant, and reception. It is also about service, and respect for customers. Do not book this hotel, and do not use Agoda for booking. Agoda provides no service, and you can see from my experience how the Hotel Modern chooses to make money. It is not just about the pictures.

Reviews.Title: “Location and customer service superb”
Reviews.Author: prholst
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Moderno twice in January 2012 and would stay there again without hesitation. Ideally situated 20m off the centre of La Ramblas, 60m from the Liceu metro station, access to this hotel is very easy. The staff were exceptionally helpful, friendly and courteous and could not do enough for us during our stay, perhaps more so than we have experienced in all of our travels. The rooms were clean, quiet and roomy enough (although not large) for us during our stay and the breakfast provided was good.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely three nights next time longer!”
Reviews.Author: Pauline L Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The exceptionally helpful Reception staff really made it easy to enjoy Barcelona.The day we were leaving there was a strike but we were warned the night before they checked to see our flight was still on and sugested a taxi to the airport all successful Moderna really want to help so accept and enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Great value, nice staff and the best location ever!”
Reviews.Author: Sara B
Reviews.Content: Our stay at moderno hotel was wonderful! Nice, clean and a very friendly staff! They helped us with names and locations of the most wonderful resturants! The location is AT THE CENTRE of barcelona! Old town (barrí gothic) is right across the street. It's a little too far to walk to the barcelonetabeach but the bus stops quite near, and the metro stays right outside. The room was no luxury - simple but oh, so clean! Hot water, cold minibar and safety deposit box in the room. Through our Swedish eyes we did missed some things at the breakfast table like full-grain bread and cereals that could have made us wait longer before eating lunch, but I didn't really mind eating more "spanish" breakfast the four days we stayed. Me and my friend rekommend this hotel for EVERYONE exept for those who wants their stay to be really beautiful to look at - then it's better to pay more and get a luxury, more expensive alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Georgiarose
Reviews.Content: The location for this hotel is excellent right in the middle of Las Ramblas and a five minute walk from Plas Catalanuya. By the time you negotiate the metro it is quicker to walk there. The staff were all really lovely and couldn't do enough for us. The rooms were a reasonable size with really comfy beds. Tea and coffee making facilities were in the room and the bathroom had a hairdryer and a good travel kit of toiletries was provided. The breakfast was excellent a good range of hot and cold meats, eggs, a wide selection of bread and plentiful fresh fruit. The coffee was freshly ground and there were also cold fruit juices. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “4-star service, 2-star rooms”
Reviews.Author: meriuimari
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Moderno for 7 nights in early February. Nothing much to complain about; wi-fi was not working, room was pretty modest, breakfast was low quality and often served cold. On positive side; great staff, perfect location, room was very clean. Ok hotel but i'll try something else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: msjessies
Reviews.Content: Stayed from four nights with friends. Receptionists offered great help with where to go and food. Incredibly helpful and nice. Excellent location, a minute from the tube station on La Ramblas.Room not very large but acceptable. Decent prize and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “our stay jan 2012”
Reviews.Author: Julie C
Reviews.Content: very good location, comfortable room double glazing great bath good breakfast would strongly recommend hotel to anyone thankyou to the very friendly staff.julie

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great location and homely rooms!”
Reviews.Author: elleaych2503
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and I was incredibly impressed with this Hotel. Upon arrival the English speaking staff were incredibly helpful and accommodating. The rooms were homely, clean and of a respectable size. The location is fabulous. Right by Las Rambla and by a main metro stop but you couldn't hear any of the noise from our room. The breakfast was fab with a great variety of foods - sausage and eggs/cereal/cooked meats/cheese/yogurt/hot drinks/juice. Would thoroughly recommend and go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Thoughtful, efficient wonderful staff and terrific location”
Reviews.Author: Julie J
Reviews.Content: Typical European rooms (small by American standards). Clean and comfortable. Very helpful staff at front desk, great recommendations for food, local interests and transportation. Televisions could use an update, and they were having an unusual internet connection issue. Wonderful restaurant next door for paella - Cullera de Boix. We would stay there again, because it was a good value for the money, and the staff were some of the most accommodating that I've had the pleasure of experiencing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: damiengobrien
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location, literally just off La Rambla, meaning you are walking distance of most of the major sites. Also means you can walk here in about 10 minutes from Plaza Catalunya where the airport bus drops you. I can honestly say that I don't think I've ever come across such helpful staff as at the Hotel Moderno, from offering advice, to printing boarding passes they could not have been more helpful. Downsides however were that the rooms were incredibly hot, and I stayed here in December. So hot that I got headaches. Furthermore the doors are impossible to close without slamming so you are awoken as soon as people have got up in the morning. The facilities themselves are basic but clean and everything you need is provided. Free fast internet is great! Overall this hotel is ok and I would stay here again although I would look for somewhere else first I think.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for seeing Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Paul1008
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with our two night stay at this hotel. It is situated very close to a good selection of bars and food outlets but is still quiet. Also well placed for visiting port area and for transport by bus or metro. The rooms were adequate. They were clean and a decent size but in 2 of the 3 rooms there was no window. The breakfasts were better than expected with a decent range of choice. We found the reception staff very helpful. For the price paid I would rate this as very good value and we would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: SarahMacDillon_2005
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel because we had enjoyed its restaurant last Nov., when we had a room at another hotel across the street. It is an older hotel, but has been updated. There are three or four computers that may be used gratis, and they always worked and there was rarely a wait for them. The wi-fi in public areas was also gratis, and dependable. There is a large and comfortable waiting space on the first floor, and also a small area with cushy furniture near the reception. Since we had plenty of time in Barcelona on this visit, we didn't feel the need to go out during a couple of downpours. We spent a few hours in the lounge area on the first floor, catching up on email and reading.The nearby breakfast room is cheerful and the buffet is more than ample. There are two pump coffee machines which produce various varieties of caffinated beverages. The staff is most helpful and friendly. The location on la Rambla, near Plaza Cataluña, was perfect for us. I have to agree with an earlier reviewer about the room service. Although in general, the room and its bathroom were relatively clean, we were there for a week and our sheets were never changed, nor were the floors swept, judging from the dust I accumulated on my stockings when I was in the room. Because of the season, we did not need the air-conditioner. The temperature in the room was just fine. We had a window and small walkout balcony over the Carrer Hospital, just off the Rambla, and the noise from revelers drifted all night into the room. Even though the windows had double panes, they were no match for happy partiers outside. This said, I will definitely be staying in this hotel again. The drawbacks are minor in comparison to the good features of this hotel - namely its excellent restaurant (which has a different name, but is listed as the "Restaurant Moderno" on charge and debit card statements), its well-informed staff, great location, good breakfast and coffee, and reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty”
Reviews.Author: MargaritaO_11
Reviews.Content: The cleaning service would come and make our beds everyday, I'm doubtful that they actually changed the sheets since my pillow case had smeared makeup on it and I don't even wear makeup to bed! The floors were never swept and they never gave us enough towels. We complained numerous times, only for the cleaning lady to get rude with us as we passed her in the hallway. Then the hotel manager accused us of trying to get out of paying our bill when we asked for some discount or compensation. The breakfast was not good and was frequently out of food and often no where to really sit. So I went over to sit on the dirty couches they had by the balcony only too look out and see prostitutes lingering around. I would not stay there again. We considered going to a different hotel but all the others were booked. I will never go to Barcelona again and would never recommend anyone to go there.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs and a screaming (yet entirely ineffectual) air-conditioning unit”
Reviews.Author: Welly81
Reviews.Content: This place sounded promising enough, with a good location just over Las Ramblas and reasonable reviews. We were only staying one night so centrality was a key feature in our choice. BOY am I glad it was only the one night. The air-conditioning rattled and moaned all night long, no matter what setting it was on - yet the room was a sauna. This was unfortunate and made for a terrible night's sleep, but a subsequent discovery turned this place into hotel hell. We'd spotted a couple of beetle-like bugs on the beds the next morning, but as we had no obvious bites (and thought bed bugs were smaller and not so easily visible) we dismissed them as an unpleasant and unwanted, but harmless addition to the room. NOT SO! A week later I discovered bed bug bites all over me. Small bumps had appeared a couple of days after I left Barcelona, but they were not itchy and given the delay, I though I'd simply had soe allergic reaction to something in Madrid, where I was then staying. However, a further 4/5 days later, the bites swelled and became red, irritated and itchy (extremely unpleasant when you've got 100s of them all over your body, including your face). My friend also had bites and this was the only place we'd stayed together - the common link! All in all, I cannot recommend this hotel. The staff were nice enough but not particularly friendly. The breakfast was very average. The location was fantastic, though the room very noisy as a result - something I would generally be prepared to put up with, were it not for the other, MAJOR problems. DO NOT STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel 200 cm from The Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: PiT_TmRO
Reviews.Content: We spend 4 days in Barcelona in February 2011 for a short City Break. The Moderno Hotel Bcn was very convenient as location, even the room was rather small for 2 adults + 9 years kid. Anyway, Barcelona is not a place where spend time in the hotel room. I recommend the Moderno Hotel Bcn for a very good quality of services vs the rate you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel 200 Mins from Las Ramblas (City Centre)”
Reviews.Author: Ktravels12
Reviews.Content: We came to stay February last year when we found a hotel deal on bookings.com for 2 nights, We arrived around 7Pm and the staff were great they told us a little local information and a good tapas bar near by !. We had a twin room on the second floor over looking the front of the hotel. The hotel had a internet point were you could use the computer for free and the next day there was a continental breakfast which was Great.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: NickSFCB
Reviews.Content: As a regular goer to Barcelona, I booked into this hotel for a short stay before ehading to the Costa Brava, as I know the area, it is clsoe to the metro station and also just off La Rambla which is ideal IMO. The hotel room was small, and I had ordered a double room, but was given a single, but charged for a double. The man on reception was pleading ignorant, and was very obnoxious pretending not to understand me, when I spoke Spanish to him, despit me listening to him speaki perfectly to a girl in Sapnish minutes before. Will not be heading back ehre again, would have been better off stopping in a cheaper hotel and saving myself some £.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back”
Reviews.Author: swiwi51
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was right in the heart of the old city and just down the road from the bus stops(hop on hop off) just off La Rambia great place at night,because we were there just a few days and only to look around the room and beds were fine,i don't know it i would have wanted to stay longer there,the breakfast was very good and if you get a change to go to Barcelona go its a lovely city with so much to see.Oh we were there in June not August,just a bit late in writing this.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: DerbyChuckie
Reviews.Content: We had read various reviews and first thought we had substituted quality for location, however this was not the case. The Hotel is located 20 paces off the La Rambla. The room was clean and tidy with a well equiped bathroom. An added bonus was a very good buffet breakfast in a pleasant dining area. The safe was free when you returned the key at the of your stay. Staff were helpful, and the location was excellant for all the shops, bars and tour bus stops.

Reviews.Title: “Tatty outstide, 1st Class inside.”
Reviews.Author: Barcelonalona
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in Hotel Moderno and found it to be all-round good value. The location was excellent, right near the Ramblas and in easy reach of all connections. Despite a scruffy exterior, the interior was spotless and the staff could not have been more helpful. Our complete lack of Spanish was no barrier and there was always a smile. The room looked onto a sealed 'shaft' so seemed a bit airless and dark but it was clean comfortable, very quiet and the aircon worked well. We did not eat in the restaurant but the breakfast in the dining room was extensive and ample. The eggs and bacon could have been kept a little warmer.

Reviews.Title: “pre cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: sasquatch27
Reviews.Content: We Stayed twice at the Moderno both pre and post cruise. The is hotel offers great value and is in a excellent location allowing easy access to the port bus and the Aerobus. Wireless Internet worked well and the included breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but what about basic hotel facilities !?”
Reviews.Author: zevik61
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from 4 night's stay at the Moderno hotel - Hotel location is indeed in the heart of the city, at the middle oi the Rambla's Blvd, close to the Liceu Metro station, but unfortunately - that's about it. We have ordered triple room and in view of previous reviews asked for a quite room - received initially internal room with no window (apart from small one to closed pear) than asked to change, and received front room with tiny balcony which was very small for 3 adults - the room decoration was basic (far from 'moderno'...), there was 2 door closet that could hardly be enough for 2 persons, tiny TV (20' max..) and no other hooks or options to hang clothes or dry towels which was quite irritating, but above all, we had 2 situations while water were not hot enought for shower/bath which is for me basic GO/NO GO aspect...- I must say rooms were clean & arranged dayly, and included 'buffet' breakfast was OK at 'value for money' index, but not at our usual level. I would than advise to consider a reservation only if you are looking for a central location with basic facilities and no much expectations.

Reviews.Title: “location is very good but it's not enough!! You can not sleep:((”
Reviews.Author: zeynepsemmo
Reviews.Content: It seems clean but in fact it's not. You can see hair in your bed, towel etc.. It is impossible to sleep because of the street's noise. The hotel does not deserve 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “close to the action”
Reviews.Author: hgaur
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located very close to the main street Ramblas in Barcelona which was the location I wanted. Most of the actin in Barcelona is here in Ramblas. So anyone looking for touristy things this hotel is ideally located. However, if someone is looking for a quite and calm location then I won't recommend this hotel. The breakfast was excellent, staff quite friendly and rooms a bit small but ok. I enjoyed my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “this place should be catagorised as a hostel not a hotel,and a bad hostel at that.”
Reviews.Author: holidaysforever18
Reviews.Content: we arrived to this 'hotel' at around midday and were greeted by the most unfriendly man at the reception desk,this person should not be front of any establishment!We had booked a double room over the internet but when we got up to our room it was a twin,in fairness they sorted us out with a double with no problems.The room was awful!A window inside the room looking out to a dingy alley covered with a filthy net curtain.The room was smelly,dark and tiny.The bathroom was ok but the towels smelt of food...like they had been dried in the kitchen..gagingly smelly.We did not eat in this place,The 'hotel' is in a great location.Barcelona in general is totally overrated in my opinion,the food is awful and the people in Barcelona are not nice.The hard rock cafe does a roaring trade due to the lack of other places to get a decent feed.

Reviews.Title: “Crooks”
Reviews.Author: Mirek21
Reviews.Content: I planned my trip to Barcelona, unfortunatelly - due to the cancelation of flights in the whole Europe (Iceland volcano) I had to change the date of my leave. Even though I tried to cancel or change reservation date 48 hours before arriving to Barcelona - it didn't matter to the hotel staff. I was charged the full price. Stay away or you're gonna be robbed.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel in Surperb Location”
Reviews.Author: BjGill2
Reviews.Content: This hotel does exactly what it says on the tin. Basic 3 star hotel in absolutely superb central location literally 30 seconds off La Ramblas. Booked this hotel late and cancelled a 4 star and much more expensive hotel and did not regreat doing so. Positives; Location - not really possible to be any better. 2 min from market, 10 min from sea front, 5 min to Placa Catalunya; price - ok prob off peak but single use of double room with breakfast for 64 euros a night really can't be bettered in this area, breakfast - perfectly adequate - good coffee, pastries and fresh fruit. Negatives; decor is dated - this is not a luxury hotel, staff are ok but not really attentive and come across as pretty disinterested - not really acknowledging you as you leave that sort of thing, many rooms including mine are internal rooms without external windows - this made the room appear constantly dark - ok in March when I'm not there during day but could be depressing in the summer, air conditioning was hopeless - only seemed to pump out constant warm air - just ended up turning it off and the room retained an ok but slightly too warm temperature despite unseasonable cold march weather. In conclusion this place is good value, in great location and I would recommend it for a solo traveller. I would not take my partner here though and pay a little more for some luxury

Reviews.Title: “Great staff clean hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: amsterdam6680
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night in the hotel, but where very impressed with the Staff, very helpful, they let us check in early, showed us places to go, on our visit. The food at breakfast was good, and much better than the hotel we where staying at in Lloret. The room was very clean and had plenty of floor space. room 403. we did have a window, but it just looked into a small lift shaft type area... But as the room was only for one night, and we where out all day, it did not matter. The only thing i would like is a bar area to have a drink in, they do have a vending machine, but its not the same after a long day walking the streets of the city. The baggage left luggage service was good, they put your room number onto the bag. and lock it away. All in all an excellent Hotel, 100 yards from the Rambles... We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous smell and no WiFi in the room”
Reviews.Author: MrMartiniMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel after we left another hotel because the WiFi in the room didn't work. When we arrived here, we were told the WiFi works in the entire hotel including all the rooms. Caught the elevator up to the 4th floor and as soon as we stepped out, there was the most disgusting smell. We thought it was just form the cleaning, and may only be in the hallway. We got to our room and the smell was stronger in there. And it was the strongest in the bathroom. The smelly was so foul it was turning our stomachs. We went straight down to reception and asked for a new room, but were told there were none available. We thought maybe if we jst open the windows put the exhaust fans on it might go. It never went, and was so strong it woke us up during the night. We discovered that the smell was coming up from their drains in teh bathroom, so you can't do anythign to stop it. The other thing was that the WiFi does not work in the rooms. it works down in the lobby, but not in the rooms. Apart from these 2 things the hotel is a nice place. They have a good breakfast buffet also. So if you can handle the foulest smell on earth and don't need internet access in your room, then this may be the palce for you. If on the other hand, you prefer to be able to breathe when staying in your hotel room - then don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Moderno not a fitting name”
Reviews.Author: poor-wandering-one
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not in the slightest bit modern- more 70s style, except for the bathroom which was a bit newer. My room was noisy. The corridor was not carpeted so you could hear people clack clack clacking along the hall. I was woken in the middle of the night both nights that I stayed. You could hear doors slamming a lot. The only thing I liked was the breakfast oh and the location was pretty good being just off la ramblas on a side street. fyi, they charge you 2 euros a night to use the room safe. I mention this because they didn't tell me this was the case at check-in. I also note that they had a few communal computers which could be useful for those sans laptops. I did not think this hotel good value and would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Very central but basic”
Reviews.Author: tweetypie39
Reviews.Content: Never been to a hotel with internal rooms before. The room we had the first night had a tiny frosted internal window, and was very claustrophobic. We switched rooms to one with an equally tiny window but at least this looked outside. When we settled in the new room i realised i had left my sandals in the first room. The staff let us check it but it had been cleaned and the shoes were gone! Nothing further was done about this and the staff just seemed to accept it. - Very disappointing. Would however recommend the hotel for location, friendliness and immaculate cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Pity! Terrible night. Manager called Jaun Marin ruined our stay”
Reviews.Author: rorykilalea
Reviews.Content: The hotel is superb- Bed and Breakfast good value. The front of house staff, the two women were the very best- SUSANNAH and the Scandinavian lady in particular. Guests were treated to excellent hospitality and advice. I cannot recommend them and th hotel enough. However the night manager Juan Marin was not only rude, but he also shouted at us - his guests. He was also totally unhelpful. The night before our departure, we had to knock on the glass door to wake him - hehad fallen asleep at the front desk watching a portable TV. We asked him for an adaptor for our phones- the ladies at Reception had asked us to ask him . He refuse to acknoweldge out requst - I drew th adaptor- he then shoutd and told us - we thought - to go and buy one for ouselvs. By this time he was shouting. Worse was to follow. When we checked out the folloiwng morning - he was still on duty. We dealt with the final extra's on the bill, and asked for the fre srvic to call a taxi.We had used this service th previous night through Susannah - and it worked a treat- cheap and efficient. It was done reluctantly and with bad grace. When th cab arrived- the driver went inside to check in with the front desk. We saw him talking to Juan Marin. We finally understood why - when we wer droppd at the Sixt Car hire office near the railway station, we wer overcharged - dpsite remonstrations - by 17 Euro's. Mr Marin had arranged this ovrcharge - of this we have no doubt. He is a disater for this nic hotel - and is theonly rsult I could not recommend this hotel. Susannah and her collague are better than most- but this man ruined our trip- rminding us of pickpockets and the darker side of Bacelona.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice location”
Reviews.Author: pkurianjohn
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the stay at Moderno because it is just 15 mts from the famous La Ramblas. Though I was very busy attending GSM congress, I could explore the main areas of Barcelona because of the location of this hotel. It is just 4 mins walk from the metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Reminds the students dormitory”
Reviews.Author: VitPetersburg
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a great location, you would need to go a long way to get the more central and more crowded location at Barcelona, yet the price also match the location, but not the interior of the hotel itself. Saying that I would like to mentioned that the staff of the hotel was very friendly and helpful, which does not make the hotel look like a real three stars - it reminded me my student dormitory at the time of my student life with all features inside, even the free internet PC places, which are of great value for the tourists of course, but the noise inside the hotel, rooms interior (or rather absence of the interior at all) and basic breakfast was a big hug from the student past for the relatively big money. Overall I would suggest the hotel for young travelers (groups, not family) traveling to Barcelona and looking for central location and do not plan to spend a lot of time inside. Beware of the crowds around and also - THERE IS NO Normal parking in near by and you have to pay ca 25 euro for a night at the parking near by!!! In general - passing hotel for the city brake and weekend at the lovely city.

Reviews.Title: “Right on the action takes place”
Reviews.Author: MetaPhoric
Reviews.Content: First things first, I´ve chosen this hotel based in one thing: the location. Very well located, in the heart of the action, but quiet, you can easily stroll around Las Ramblas as you please and see the fabulous human statues or get in the metro station that takes you almost everywhere. Not much variety at the breakfast buffet, but we aren´t picky and managed to find something we like to eat. The room was simple, with a good size, but very clean, all that matters to us. One thing I have to say is that the hotel isn´t the cheapest but it´s worth it because what I´ve said and repeat: the location. Don´t miss, besides strolling the Ramblas, the magnificent Parc Güell, the Gothic district, the Mare Magnum Shopping Center, the harbour and the beach. We liked - The location We disliked - Could be a little cheaper

Reviews.Title: “Overall satisfied”
Reviews.Author: hat776
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel extremely convenient as it is just a few meters from the Ramblas. Our room overlooked the road, just above the entrance, but was still quiet. It was large and the bathroom was modern. Every thing was clean. The entrance was rather basic and receptionist was helpful. Breakfast was not exceptional, but good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and friendly”
Reviews.Author: pooyousir
Reviews.Content: For the low price and great location, it was so much better than what I expected. The staff were polite and helpful, the room was small but clean and secure. No view from window though. And don't go to the pub opposite unless you want to go to an English pub. Hotel is right next to a cash point, and 10 meters from La Rambla.

Reviews.Title: “Ruined one full day of our short break”
Reviews.Author: Benfromsydney
Reviews.Content: We are a married couple who travel quite regularly and book through hotel websites everytime. We booked this one on the day we arrived and when we got to the hotel the staff were quite rude. Not thinking anything of it, we proceeded to our room and found they had put us in a twin room. so we went back to reception as we had booked a double room. On explaining that there was an error the 2 men on reception were abusive, rude and trying to tell us that in europe a double room means 2 singles. we asked for a refund and they would not give it to us. we stayed calm and polite through this and just wanted to leave then after much more yelling and insults from the men in both english and spanish we were given another room (110) which was a dark, pokey room in the back of the hotel with a mossy brick wall as the view (the first room they gave us had a balcony) This hotel is cheap and accordingly nasty, the staff are intimidating and rude. As we left they joked in spanish they would use my Credit Card details to buy his wife a gift. (thinking we could not understand) This was a simple mistake they could have rectified in seconds and instead they upset us and ruined our holiday. Dont stay here! other hotels in barcelona for the same price are 10 times better. PS yes, i did cancel my CC.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: jellybaby0112
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location for tourists, just metres off La Rambla. The room was basic, but lovely and clean and although the view from the window was a little poor, it doesn't matter because you're up early in the morning and in again late at night. The breakfast was nice too, really set you up for the day. Moderno is about 10 mins walk either way to the marina and to the centre of the city , everything is very accessible. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good, clean, central accomadation”
Reviews.Author: ohafc
Reviews.Content: 6 of us stayed here from 12-14 april 07 for a stag do in 2 twin rooms, i know barca well and this is a good 3* hotel location - just off ramblas,perfect - safe side st, opp leicu metro, not as loud/noisy as people make out, like any major city just have you're wits about you! rooms - clean, smart, comftable, 3 single beds (with no view) staff - superb ! spoke english, v.helpful, luggage room if you need to store your stuff for a late flight arrival - get blue single decker bus from outside airport , 3.90 euros straight to placa catalunya then walk 5 mins down ramblas then turn right down the road just after boquaria market would recommend as a v.good 2nd choice but try - hotel nh de la victoria as 1st choice (2 min walk from moderno) - brilliant, best hotel in barca Dont go in 'The Wild Turkey' bar over the road from the hotel - big rip off ! Try the Queen Vic (just futher down the Ramblas, little road on right called - something......... de la Ramblas) If you need a British bar - very good prices, sky sports and Newcastle Brown on draft !!!

Reviews.Title: “A short ramble from La Rambla.”
Reviews.Author: terryulsterman
Reviews.Content: Perfectly situated just off La Rambla, Hotel Moderno offers basic but satisfactory accommodation. Be warned though it can be very noisey at night and the area does attract a few less savoury members of society!! Staff are very welcoming and speak good English. Rooms are small clean and well equipped - a kettle would be a nice addition. Breakfast, which is included in the price, is the usual continental affair. Starting service for breakfast at 8am might be a problem for those with an early start to the day. Personally I thought it was expensive for what it was.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and Inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: QueenJBelgium
Reviews.Content: We originally booked a hotel online, only to arrive and find it was NOT what we had hoped for and at 11 PM started looking for a different hotel. Lucky for us, we found the Moderno. The wonderful older desk clerk was kindness itself, and gave us an unbelievable rate -69Euro per room, per night including breakfast! We had an interior room-no view but oh so quiet! The room was simple and modern, good sized and immaculate, as was the bathroom. The breakfast was a nice Catalan style with meats, cheeses, cereal, fresh fruit, juice and of course breads, rolls and coffee. Just steps from the Ramblas, it was the perfect small hotel. Not a lot of trimmings, but a good value. ONE note of caution - the rooms are Not soundproof, and you can hear a bit of noise from the other travelers as they come and go. But for that rate I can pack ear plugs! I would gladly return.

Reviews.Title: “Basic as it comes”
Reviews.Author: Magnum
Reviews.Content: Having never been to Barcelona before I really wanted this short 4 day trip to be unspoiled. However the moderno hotel put an end to that idea. Let me start with its relatively good point. Location is superb. And that’s it! Right in the heart of the busy Ramblas area you can explore many of Barcelona’s attractions on foot, as long as you wear a good pair of walking shoes. However the rooms we were allocated were no more than shoeboxes. My friend’s room was more suitable for a hamster, and his morning view was the inner walls of the hotel itself. More akin to a cheap hostel size or a prison .The bathroom floors were so dirty I had to ask the cleaners to mop it again to remove the hairs all over the floor. The breakfast, although continental is far from adoqute.I was offered more choice in a cheaper hostel in Amsterdam recently. If you’re a vegetarian then forget it. Its cornflakes or cheese and bread. Once, there was no milk left for coffee, and another morning my half eaten breakfast was swiftly removed from my table as I stood up to get another drink. But by far the worst aspect of this hotel is the noise. I didn’t get a single good nights sleep whilst there. You hear every footstep and every banging door throughout the night and early next morning. I wish someone on trip advisor had warned readers of this, and I for one would definitely not have stayed. On my last morning they were actually doing work on the next room. The noise was atrocious. And to the end this inaccurately 3starred hotel overcharged for the rooms. I disputed the bill twice pointing out that by email I was assured this was the final amount. This fell on deaf ears and I was advised this is the tax on top. So why tell me otherwise before arrival? All in all, the place is overpriced for what you get, and the service is mediocre at best. The rooms are nothing more than tiny cupboards and the food as bare as it can comes. If you’re stuck, and there is nowhere else to choose, then maybe worth a look. But confirm in writing the total Inc tax before hand, and ask about the view of the room first. Also, be sure to take ear plugs, you’ll need them.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location!”
Reviews.Author: mairead_k
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel is amazing... You literally walk out the door and you're on one of the worlds most amazing streets. Hotel room was large, very clean and comfortable. However the 1st floor room was a bit dark as the "window" was out into a small area which led up to a skylight. Apart from this, oh and a clearer dropping in at a very early 09.30 (no idea why!!!) when checkout was not til 12.00, this hotel was worth the very good last minute booking! I would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated at the ramblas, most attractions are in walking distance. Large and clean rooms/bath (newly refurbished). Breakfast could be more various, but all in all the hotel is absolutely great value for the money (we paid 250 € for 4 nights).
